row.origin: Made in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States, North and Central America
row.creditLine: Gift of Mrs. Thomas Eakins and Miss Mary Adeline Williams, 1929
row.labelOnPage: Most of Eakins's paintings after 1886 were portraits, but he returned to sporting subjects in the late 1890s with a series that he began after attending professional boxing matches at the Philadelphia Arena (then located at the intersection of Broad and Cherry Streets, diagonally across from the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts). The resulting canvases were as revolutionary in their subject matter as his rowing scenes had been more than two decades earlier.
row.name: Thomas Eakins
row.title: Between Rounds
